Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Role of the Iliocapsularis Muscle in Hip Stability

Trial_Design.evidence: 85 participants were recruited from a single orthopedic center

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included adults with hip dysplasia or femoroacetabular impingement.

Intervention.evidence: Group I (deficient acetabular coverage) and 40 hips in Group II (excessive acetabular coverage)

Objective.evidence: This study investigates its anatomical dimensions and fatty infiltration in hips with deficient versus excessive acetabular coverage.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in muscle dimensions and fatty infiltration between groups, measured over a 6-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealed via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group allocation.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 85 participants were recruited from a single orthopedic center

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis, with all 85 participants included.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference in CSA was significant (p < 0.05).

Funding.evidence: This study was funded by [Funding source].
